content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

The target structure appears to be a small house or doorway with the following characteristics:

- The structure has 3 layers:
  - Bottom layer: Red arch-like base with an opening (doorway)
  - Middle layer: Two yellow semi-cylindrical blocks side by side
  - Top layer: An orange/red triangular roof piece

- Total block count: 4 blocks (1 red arch base, 2 yellow semi-cylindrical blocks, 1 orange triangular roof)

- Spatial relationships:
  - The red arch serves as the foundation
  - Two yellow semi-cylindrical blocks sit on top of the red arch, positioned side by side horizontally
  - The orange triangular roof piece sits on top of the yellow blocks, centered on the structure

## Selected Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on the target structure, I need the following blocks:

1. Red arch base: Block with index 1
2. Yellow semi-cylindrical blocks (2 of them): Blocks with index 6 and 7
3. Orange triangular roof: Block with index 14

## Assembly Order

{
  Step1: Move block with index 1
  Step2: Move block with index 6
  Step3: Move block with index 7
  Step4: Move block with index 14
}

This assembly order follows the logical bottom-to-top construction process, starting with the foundation (red arch), adding the middle layer of yellow semi-cylindrical blocks, and finishing with the triangular roof piece.
